### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE employee_information (
  employee_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  full_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  position VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  shift_id UUID,
  hourly_rate DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL
)

### STATEMENT

UPDATE employee_information SET position = 'Manager' WHERE employee_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE employee_information (
  employee_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  full_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  position VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  shift_id UUID,
  hourly_rate DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL
)

UPDATE employee_information SET position = 'Supervisor', shift_id = '98765432-1234-5678-9abc-098765432111' WHERE hourly_rate > 15.00;

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    position VARCHAR(50),
    hourly_rate DECIMAL(10,2)
)

CREATE TABLE shifts (
    shift_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    shift_date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME,
    employee_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE payroll (
    payroll_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    pay_date DATE,
    hours_worked DECIMAL(10,2),
    total_pay DECIMAL(10,2),
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    shift_id INT,
    date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (shift_id) REFERENCES shifts(shift_id)
)

### STATEMENT

UPDATE employees SET position = 'Manager' WHERE employee_id = 1;
